skill.name: benchling-integration
skill.description: Benchling R&D platform integration. Access registry (DNA, proteins), inventory, ELN entries, workflows via API, build Benchling Apps, query Data Warehouse, for lab data management automation.
skill.summary: Benchling R&D platform integration. Access registry (DNA, proteins), inventory, ELN entries, workflo...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill is documentation with example SDK and REST usage. Examples show network requests, environment variable access, and local file writes. No executable scripts or obfuscated behavior are present.

content.value_statement: Benchling data tasks are slow when done manually. This skill gives clear SDK and REST patterns to automate registry, inventory, and ELN work.
actual_capabilities: Explains API key, OAuth, and OIDC authentication flows
Shows CRUD patterns for registry entities and custom entities
Details inventory actions for containers, boxes, and transfers
Describes ELN entry creation and entity linking
Lists REST endpoints, pagination, and rate limit handling
limitations: Requires a Benchling tenant and valid API credentials
Documentation only, it does not execute API calls
Examples focus on Python SDK and REST patterns
Data Warehouse usage is high level without SQL examples

use_cases.title: Automate registry updates
use_cases.description: Create and update DNA, RNA, and protein records with consistent SDK patterns.

use_cases.title: Track samples and locations
use_cases.description: Create containers and transfer items between boxes and locations with API steps.

use_cases.title: Extract ELN and workflow data
use_cases.description: List entries and workflow tasks for reporting and downstream analysis.

prompt_templates.title: First API call
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to authenticate with an API key and list the first page of DNA sequences.

prompt_templates.title: Create a DNA record
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a Python SDK example to create a DNA sequence with fields and a folder ID.

prompt_templates.title: Move inventory
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to transfer a container to a new box and update its volume field.

prompt_templates.title: Workflow automation
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft steps to create a workflow task, mark it complete, and wait for async status.

output_examples.input: Explain how to authenticate and list DNA sequences using the SDK.
output: Set BENCHLING_TENANT_URL and BENCHLING_API_KEY as environment variables
Initialize the Benchling client with ApiKeyAuth
Call dna_sequences.list and iterate pages to see names and IDs

best_practices: Store credentials in environment variables and rotate keys regularly
Use server side filters and pagination to reduce data transfer
Handle 429 responses with retry and backoff strategies
anti_patterns: Hardcoding API keys in source files
Fetching all entities and filtering only on the client
Ignoring rate limit responses and retry guidance

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Benchling tenants?
faq.answer: It requires a Benchling tenant with API access enabled and valid credentials.

faq.question: Are there usage limits I should know?
faq.answer: Benchling enforces rate limits and returns 429 responses when exceeded.

faq.question: Can I integrate with other systems?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill documents REST patterns suitable for external integrations.

faq.question: How is data safety handled?
faq.answer: It recommends secure credential storage and least privilege access.

faq.question: What should I do if authentication fails?
faq.answer: Verify credentials, permissions, tenant URL, and Authorization header format.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual UI work?
faq.answer: API and SDK workflows enable repeatable automation beyond manual entry.
